detaileddescription.para: Command enum for the xmlrpc message generator
Command enum for the xmlrpc message generator

briefdescription.para: Stops the generator at any place.

detaileddescription.para: Use this number for selecting custom tag strings where RPC_CUSTOM_TAG is the first (0) string of your custom array and RPC_CUSTOM_TAG+X, tag X in your array

briefdescription.para: place text "hasParam" in the current open tag
place text "registerPublisher" in the current open tag
place text "registerSubscriber" in the current open tag
place text "requestTopic" in the current open tag
place text "tcp_keepalive" in the current open tag
place text "unregisterPublisher" in the current open tag
place text "unregisterSubscriber" in the current open tag

detaileddescription.para: Use this number for selecting custom text strings where RPC_CUSTOM_TEXT is the first (0) string of your custom array and RPC_CUSTOM_TAG+X, tag X in your array
This enum holds the commands for the rpc XML generator

briefdescription.para: This is required on any header generation array end.

detaileddescription.para: Values specifying most used standard field descriptors
This specifies to use a text in the custom text array as descriptor
Values specifying most used standard text pieces
This specifies to use a text in the custom text array as value

briefdescription.para: This mode does just insert the given string.
This mode will insert the string with tag brackets.
This mode will insert the string as closing tag.
This mode adds a : to the string.
This mode adds a space infront and a newline at the back of the string.

detaileddescription.para: These are the modes for the str2buf function

This function copies a string into a buffer. The starting point inside the string is given with the index pointer, which is also increased. This is used to be able to add multiple strings behind each other in the same buffer. Be sure your buffer is big enough, there are no checks for the buffer size for increasing performance!

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to write the string to.
The terminated string to write into the buffer
This specifies the mode, see str2buf_modes enum

detaileddescription.para:
This function can be used to generate headers for a HTTP message.
message_buffer
The output buffer for the message
gen_array
The command array for generating messages.
custom_string_array
The array for custom strings
buf_index
The index for the output buffer
Message length

memberdef.argsstring: (char *message_buffer, ros_rpc_gen_command *gen_array, char **custom_string_array, unsigned int *gen_index, unsigned int *buf_index)
memberdef.name: generateXML

detaileddescription.para:
This function generates a xmlrpc message
message_buffer
The output buffer for the message
gen_array
The command array for generating messages.
custom_string_array
The array for custom strings (topics, params etc.)
gen_index
The index for the gen_array, set to 0 at start, increased by each call of generate_XML
buf_index
The index for the output buffer
Message length
